oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 1 from oral history interview with Wallace Westfeldt, 2002 October 31
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville Civil Rights Movement participant Wallace Westfeldt, conducted on 31 October 2002 by Milt Capps as part of the Nashville Public Library's Civil Rights Oral History Project. Westfeldt, a journalist, discusses how he came to cover Nashville's Civil Rights Movement during the 1950s for the Tennessean newspaper. The complete interview, as well as a transcript, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Westfeldt, Wallace--Interviews
Tennessean (Nashville, Tenn. : 1972)
